body:
Installing a CUDA-aware MPI in the defaults, e.g. with
```bash
spack install mpi+cuda
```

does not properly select `openmpi+cuda` but just the plain `openmpi~cuda` default.

Since "CUDA-Awareness" (yes/no) is a MPI property of nearly all [popular MPI implementations](https://devblogs.nvidia.com/parallelforall/introduction-cuda-aware-mpi/), it would make sense to be able to define `+cuda` as a variant of the virtual `mpi` package.

CUDA Aware MPI implementations from the 2013 blog post above:

    MVAPICH2 1.8/1.9b
    OpenMPI 1.7 (beta)
    CRAY MPI (MPT 5.6.2)
    IBM Platform MPI (8.3)
    SGI MPI (1.08)
title: Variants on Virtual Packages: mpi+cuda
